video.name: Instant Pot Chana Saag - Chickpea Spinach Curry | Vegan Richa
video.description:
Instant Pot Chana Saag! Chickpea Spinach Curry. 
RECIPE: http://www.veganricha.com/2017/07/chana-saag-chickpea-spinach-curry-instant-pot.html

EASY 1 Pot Chickpea Curry. Finely Chop or Puree the greens for a blended sauce like Saag. See Recipe post for variations and Saucepan option.

Chana Palak / Palak Chole. Pressure Cook or Saucepan. Vegan Gluten-free Nut-free Recipe.

SUBSCRIBE: https://www.youtube.com/veganricharecipes?sub_confirmation=1

#vegan #veganism #easyveganrecipes #veganrecipes #veganricha #cooking

recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup dried chickpeas (soaked for atleast 4 hours in warm water)
1/2 tsp each ground cumin (garam masala, paprika)
15 oz can tomatoes  (or 2 large tomatoes diced)
1.5 cups water (,1 cup for less stewy dish)
2-3  packed cups chopped spinach (,chard or combination greens (8 to 12 oz), use amount to preference)
cayenne and garam masala for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the soaked chickpeaas, wash well, drain and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain the soaked chickpeaas, wash well, drain and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Press Saute on the Instant pot. Let the pot get hot for 2 mins. Add oil and spread using a spatula.
recipeInstructions.name: Press Saute on the Instant pot. Let the pot get hot for 2 mins. Add oil and spread using a spatula.

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile. Mince and mix together or process the onion, ginger, garlic and hot chile. Add to the hot oil. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring frequently.
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile. Mince and mix together or process the onion, ginger, garlic and hot chile. Add to the hot oil. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring frequently.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the spices(cumin garam masala, paprika, coriander) and mix in. Add the tomatoes and bring to a boil. Mash the larger pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the spices(cumin garam masala, paprika, coriander) and mix in. Add the tomatoes and bring to a boil. Mash the larger pieces.

recipeInstructions.text: Add washed and drained chickpeas, salt and water. Close the lid and put the knob on sealing.
recipeInstructions.name: Add washed and drained chickpeas, salt and water. Close the lid and put the knob on sealing.

recipeInstructions.text: Pressure Cook for 25 to 30 minutes. I usually cook for 30 minutes to be on the safe side as older chickpeas take a bit longer to cook.
recipeInstructions.name: Pressure Cook for 25 to 30 minutes. I usually cook for 30 minutes to be on the safe side as older chickpeas take a bit longer to cook.

recipeInstructions.text: Quick release after 10 mins. Press saute. Fold in the greens and non dairy milk.. Taste and adjust salt. Cook for 2 to 4 mins to wilt the greens.
recipeInstructions.name: Quick release after 10 mins. Press saute. Fold in the greens and non dairy milk.. Taste and adjust salt. Cook for 2 to 4 mins to wilt the greens.

recipeInstructions.text: Add cayenne and lemon juice and mix in. Serve hot over rice or with roti or naan.
recipeInstructions.name: Add cayenne and lemon juice and mix in. Serve hot over rice or with roti or naan.
